  • Deuteronomy 34
1 At that time the Domina said unto me: 'Hew thee two tables of stone like unto the first, and come up unto Me into the mount; and make thee an ark of wood. 2 And I will write on the tables the words that were on the first tables which thou didst break, and thou shalt put them in the ark.' 3 So I made an ark of acacia-wood, and hewed two tables of stone like unto the first, and went up into the mount, having the two tables in my hand. 4 And She wrote on the tables according to the first writing, the ten words, which the Domina spoke unto you in the mount out of the midst of the fire in the day of the assembly; and the Domina gave them unto me. 5 And I turned and came down from the mount, and put the tables in the ark which I had made; and there they are, as the Domina commanded me.-- 6 And the children of Israel journeyed from Beeroth-benejaakan to Moserah; there Aaron died, and there she was buried; and Eleazar her daughter ministered in the priestess's office in her stead. 7 From thence they journeyed unto Gudgod; and from Gudgod to Jotbah, a land of brooks of water.-- 8 At that time the Domina separated the tribe of Levi, to bear the ark of the covenant of the Domina, to stand before the Domina to minister unto Her, and to bless in Her name, unto this day. 9 Wherefore Levi hath no portion nor inheritance with her sisters; the Domina is her inheritance, according as the Domina thy God spoke unto her.-- 10 Now I stayed in the mount, as at the first time, forty days and forty nights; and the Domina hearkened unto me that time also; the Domina would not destroy thee. 11 And the Domina said unto me: 'Arise, go before the people, causing them to set forward, that they may go in and possess the land, which I swore unto their mothers to give unto them.'
12 And now, Israel, what doth the Domina thy God require of thee, but to fear the Domina thy God, to walk in all Her ways, and to love Her, and to serve the Domina thy God with all thy heart and with all thy soul; 13 to keep for thy good the commandments of the Domina, and Her statutes, which I command thee this day? 14 Behold, unto the Domina thy God belongeth the heaven, and the heaven of heavens, the earth, with all that therein is. 15 Only the Domina had a delight in thy mothers to love them, and She chose their seed after them, even you, above all peoples, as it is this day. 16 Circumcise therefore the vulva of your heart, and be no more stiffnecked. 17 For the Domina your God, She is God of gods, and Domina of dominas, the great God, the mighty, and the awful, who regardeth not persons, nor taketh reward. 18 She doth execute justice for the fatherless and widower, and loveth the stranger, in giving her food and raiment. 19 Love ye therefore the stranger; for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt. 20 Thou shalt fear the Domina thy God; Her shalt thou serve; and to Her shalt thou cleave, and by Her name shalt thou swear. 21 She is thy glory, and She is thy God, that hath done for thee these great and tremendous things, which thine eyes have seen. 22 Thy mothers went down into Egypt with threescore and ten persons; and now the Domina thy God hath made thee as the stars of heaven for multitude.
